result.execSummary:
The defendant Braydon A. Gustafson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Criminal Trespass to Dwelling [Modifiers: Party to a Crime], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.14.
  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500 [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime, Penalty-Theft if Value <=$2500], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Pay costs on each count of the action. Pay supervision fees as ordered by Dept. of Corrections. If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
Maintain full time employment and/or school.
Complete any counseling, evaluations, programs and assessments as appropriate resulting from the Department's COMPAS assessment.
Obtain AODA assessment and comply with treatment recommendations.

timeConds.notes: Huber privileges granted.  60 days to report.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Braydon A. Gustafson

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.
Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt: Defendant Braydon A. Gustafson in court with attorney Luca L Fagundes.  Joan M Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. State moves to amend Count 1 to Criminal Trespass. Court reviews max. penalties, elements, party to a crime. Defendant enters no contest pleas to Counts 1, 2. Court questions Defendant on rights, finds pleas made freely and voluntarily, accepts pleas, and finds Defendant guilty of Counts 1, 2. State/Defense make joint sentencing recommendations. Bond no longer in effect.
Defense waives reading of Information, enters not guilty pleas. Bond continues as is.

Defendant Braydon A. Gustafson in court with attorney Luca Lopes Fagundes. Raymond L. Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense advises that Defendant will waive prelim. Court questions Defendant, finds waiver made freely and voluntarily, accepts waiver and binds Defendant over for trial.  Status conference scheduled for May 12, 2014 at 10:00 am.
Preliminary hearing on March 26, 2014 at 03:30 pm.

Defendant Braydon A. Gustafson in court with attorney Luca Lopes Fagundes.  Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense requests prelim ASAP.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 26, 2014 at 03:30 pm.
No contact direct or indirect with DP, SS, AC, BC.  Defendant must live with mother at 9325 Fox Lane.
Defense presents argument for amended bond.  State objects to modification.  Court reduces bond to $200 cash with condition that he live with his mother.

Defendant Braydon A. Gustafson in court with attorney Luca L Fagundes.  Defendant Braydon A. Gustafson in custody.  Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Copy of Complaint given to Defendant in Court.  Court reviews charges, max. penalties, right to counsel, right to prelim. Defense advises that Defendant will waive time limits for prelim. Court questions Defendant, finds waiver made freely and voluntarily, accepts waiver.  Defense requests that case be set for status conference.  Status conference scheduled for March 3, 2014 at 10:00 am.
from Atty Fagundes requesting that 1/6 appearance be rescheduled to 1/13.  Per Court, ok.
No contact direct or indirect with DP, SS, AC, BC.  To be fingerprinted and photographed before leaving Justice Center.

Defendant Braydon A. Gustafson in court with attorney Eric Maciolek.  Raymond L Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State gives incident report, potential charges.  Court questions Defendant on address/employment history, reviews right to Counsel.  Court finds probable cause, sets bond.  Atty Maciolek advises that he will not be handling case, will attempt to have Counsel appointed by 1/6.  Return 1/6/14, 10:00.
